article.headline: San Diego 80, Furman 73
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. (AP) -- Junior guard Ross DeRogatis tied his career high with 28 points on 8-of-10 3-point shootings to lead San Diego over Furman 80-73 on Saturday. Senior center Nick Lewis added 16 points in a game-high eight rebounds for the Toreros (4-2), who won their third straight game. Senior center Moussa Diagne had a career-high 25 points on 12-of-17 shootings to pace the Paladins (3-3). DeRogatis scored 10 of San Diego's final 14 points, including a 3-pointer from the right corner with 17 seconds left to cut short the 19-4 Furman rally and give the Toreros breathing room at 76-71. His two free throws 8 seconds later made it 78-71 and sealed the win. DiRogatis hit 5-of-7 bonus shots in the first half as San Diego broke from a 23-22 deficit to take a 43-26 halftime lead. Diagne scored 8 during a 16-6 run to open the second half and cut the Toreros lead to 49-42. San Diego rallied to regain a 17-point advantage at 69-52 on DiRogatis' 3-pointer with 4:34 remaining . Furman then opened its 19-4 run on Eric Webb's 3-point shot at 4:18.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
